alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 11:31PM CDT until June 12 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR SHELBY...NORTHEASTERN BIBB...SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 1130 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Argo to near Pelham to near Tannehill Ironworks State Park, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Eastern Birmingham, Hoover, Vestavia Hills, Alabaster, Bessemer, Homewood, Pelham, Mountain Brook, Trussville, Helena, Pell City, Irondale, Leeds, Moody, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Columbiana, Springville and Odenville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
